Three were chosen by powerful Families, taken in, trained, and recognized as future heroes.

Without blessing, without name, without resources, Leo walked alone through the most dangerous city in the world. In a desperate act, he descended into the dungeon without weapons, without equipment, and without hope.

There, on the brink of death, a god forgotten by the world found him.

He has no followers. He has no temple. He is not recognized by the Guild. But he possesses an ancient power that other gods fear to remember.

Is it worth becoming a hero... if everything you stand for could be a lie?

This is the story of the weakest of the reincarnated group... and how his indomitable will changed the fate of a world.

--- Because even the forgotten can change the course of the world. ---

title: Gentle Parenting in the Apocalypse (Book 1: Origins of an NPC)
author: Axios2525
description:
The System rewards excellence, and Earth‚Äîbefore it became a footnote in cosmic history‚Äîhad excellence in spades. We excelled at everything: warfare and romance, mass destruction and boundless creativity, cruelty and kindness.

From the ashes of Earth a new generation of legends were born. The Lady of the Wilds. The Endless Storm. Legion. The Eternal Dreamer. Karen. Bob. The Sun Reborn. He Who Screams into the Abyss and Stares into the Void (trust me, he's exactly as insufferable as he sounds). Bruno‚Ä¶whom we've collectively agreed not to discuss. The list goes on.

These legends reshaped reality and carved their names across the stars.I'm not one of them. I've stood beside them, bled with them, even changed some of their diapers. But you won't find me in the historical records, except perhaps as "unnamed associate" on page 394. That suits me fine.

When everything went to hell, I didn't discover any ancient bloodlines or awaken primal powers. I was just your average late 30s recovering-from-burn-out millennial dad doing his best, who suddenly had to figure out how to gentle parent his way through the apocalypse with his 6 year old girl and her army of imaginary friends.

I never aspired to heroism, yet heroes surround me. I only wanted to be a decent father, loving husband, occasional maker of interesting things, sometimes fisherman, and amateur delver-of-forgotten-places. You know - normal System Apocalypse stuff.

Note from Author: If you're looking for a story about a OP MC who is a genius of his era - this isn't it.¬† This is the story of your average guy, doing his best in an impossible situation.¬† Will there be adventure? Yes.¬† Action? Assuredly.¬† Danger? Indubitably.¬† Trying to reason with a 6 year old? 100%.¬† Woke leftist overtones? Without a doubt.¬† Harems? Not a chance in¬† H E double hockey sticks.

They say the last mule slept with the taste of peaches on his tongue and the steam of coffee in his chest, on a green shoulder of the world where wind spoke only in sighs. For years he kept his silence; for years the living forgot there was a quiet that needed guarding.

When hands of greed reached their claws toward his peace, the mountain answered. Flesh turned to root and root to granite; life‚Äôs hot, anxious rush cooled into a silence so deep it was mistaken for mercy. To the onlooker it was terror beyond measure‚Äîhow can a heart watch itself become the land? How can a man keep his name when his hands are soil? The continent learned a new fear that day: not of conquest, but of being remembered forever.

The Immovables receded when the world bowed; their footprints remained‚Äîvales of stone where laughter used to be. Poets would later call that day the Verdant Reckoning: a calamity that asks, once and forever, whether the living will learn to leave peace unplundered.

Once a land of vibrant forests, fertile plains, and glittering rivers, the Sixth Kingdom was the region most devastated by the nuclear war. It is the source of both awe and terror‚Äîits corrupting influence believed to be the reason for the kingdom‚Äôs mindless mutations.

No ruler governs this land. Instead, the monsters themselves act as gatekeepers, ensuring only the strongest survive long enough to glimpse the gem‚Äôs glow. Over centuries, the Sixth Kingdom became a forbidden zone, a nightmare realm whispered of in the other lands.

Yet, it is also the greatest prize. Every war, every alliance, every betrayal across the five kingdoms circles back to the Sixth. For whoever claims the Gem of Eternity does not only gain unending life but also the power to rewrite the fate of the world.
